TITLE: North Korea fires 3 missiles amid tensions over drone flights
SUMMARY: A TV screen shows a file image of North Korea's rocket with the test satellite during a news program at the Seoul Railway Station in Seoul, South Korea, on Saturday

TITLE: Chinese manufacturing weakens amid COVID-19 outbreak
SUMMARY: Shoppers walk through a reopened shopping mall after authorities started easing some of the anti-virus controls in Beijing on Dec. 6, 2022. Chinese manufacturing weakened for a third consecutive month in December, in the biggest drop since early 2020, as the country battles a nationwide COVID-19 surge after suddenly easing its anti-epidemic measures

TITLE: In Afghanistan, coal mining relies on the labor of children
SUMMARY: A boy works in a coal mine north of Kabul. Afghanistan's state-run coal industry is going strong in an otherwise shattered economy. Many underage workers are the ones who are extracting the coal

TITLE: A U.N. official met with a Taliban leader over a ban on women working for NGOs
SUMMARY: A Save the Children nutrition counsellor, right, explains to Nelab, 22, how to feed her 11-month-old daughter, Parsto, with therapeutic food, which is used to treat severe acute malnutrition, in Sar-e-Pul province of Afghanistan in September 2022. Save the Children via AP

TITLE: North Korea's Kim orders 'exponential' expansion of nuclear arsenal
SUMMARY: In this photo provided by the North Korean government, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, center, attends a ceremony of donating 600 mm super-large multiple launch rocket system at a garden of the Workers' Party of Korea headquarters in Pyongyang, North Korea, on Saturday, Dec. 31, 2022. Korean Central News Agency/Korea News Service via AP

TITLE: Rana Ayyub fights for press freedom in India despite harassment and death threats
SUMMARY: Indian journalist Rana Ayyub speaks during the launch of her self published book 'Gujarat Files' in New Delhi in May 2016. On March 29, 2022, Ayyub was prevented from flying to Europe to speak about online violence on female journalists. Hindustan Times via Getty Images

TITLE: People in Tokyo wait in line 3 hours for a taste of these Japanese rice balls
SUMMARY: A lunch at Onigiri Bongo includes mustard green and salmon flake onigiri, miso soup, pickles and green tea

TITLE: Biden's national security adviser is hopeful war over Taiwan can be prevented
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep interviews U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan in Washington, D.C. on Jan. 5, 2023

TITLE: His poem polarized India. Now comedian Vir Das is telling his side
SUMMARY: Vir Das attends the International Emmy Awards in 2021 in New York City

TITLE: China's authorities are quietly rounding up people who protested against COVID rules
SUMMARY: Students hold up placards including blank white sheets of paper on the campus of the Chinese University of Hong Kong, in solidarity with protests held on the mainland over Beijing's COVID-19 restrictions, on Nov. 28. Peter Parks/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: 'It's like gold': Onions now cost more than meat in the Philippines
SUMMARY: A worker rides an overloaded tricycle carrying bags of onions in Manila, Philippines on Sept. 23, 2015

TITLE: South Korean police seek manslaughter charges over deadly crowd surge
SUMMARY: Rescue workers treat injured people on the street near the scene of a crowd surge in Seoul, South Korea, on Oct. 30, 2022. South Korean police on Friday, Jan. 13, 2023, said they are seeking charges of involuntary manslaughter and negligence against 23 officials

TITLE: China's COVID surge prompts CDC to expand a hunt for new variants among air travelers
SUMMARY: In hopes of getting a better sense of which SARS-CoV-2 variants might be coming into the U.S., the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recently expanded its voluntary testing of some passengers exiting from international flights at certain airports

TITLE: A passenger plane with 72 people on board has crashed in Nepal, killing dozens
SUMMARY: Locals watch the wreckage of a passenger plane in Pokhara, Nepal, Sunday, Jan.15, 2023. A passenger plane with 72 people on board has crashed near Pokhara International Airport in Nepal, the daily newspaper Kathmandu Post reports. The plane was carrying 68 passengers and four crew members

TITLE: Kabul's mannequins hooded and masked under Taliban rules
SUMMARY: A mannequin's head is covered in a woman dress shop in Kabul, Afghanistan, Monday, Dec. 26, 2022

TITLE: Here's why China's population dropped for the first time in decades
SUMMARY: A man pulls a child past a Lunar New Year decoration on display at the Qianmen pedestrian shopping street, a popular tourist spot in Beijing, on Tuesday

TITLE: China's economic growth falls to 3% in 2022 but slowly reviving
SUMMARY: A crane lifts a shipping container at a container port in Tianjin, China, Monday, Jan. 16, 2023. China's economic growth fell to 3% last year under pressure from antivirus controls and a real estate slump

TITLE: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern plans to leave office
SUMMARY: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announced her resignation plans on Wednesday in Napier, New Zealand. It is unclear who would succeed her

TITLE: Nobel winner Maria Ressa and her online news outlet are cleared of tax evasion
SUMMARY: Filipino journalist Maria Ressa, one of the winners of the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize and Rappler CEO, speaks to the media after a court decision at the Court of Tax Appeals in Quezon City, Philippines. The court on Wednesday cleared Ressa and her online news company of tax evasion charges

TITLE: Holiday Traditions in China and Ukraine Offer Comfort During Uncertain Times
SUMMARY: A lantern show in Nanjing, in China's eastern Jiangsu province, ahead of the Lunar New Year of the Rabbit. This year the holiday falls amid a massive COVID surge and an economic slump. STR/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: China is celebrating the Lunar New Year, with most COVID rules lifted
SUMMARY: A woman poses for a selfie on a bridge decorated with lanterns at a public park in Beijing on the first day of the Lunar New Year holiday, Sunday, Jan. 22, 2023

TITLE: India's government scrambles to block a film about Modi's role in anti-Muslim riots
SUMMARY: Students watch security personnel guard the main gate of Jamia Millia Islamia university Wednesday in New Delhi, India. A student group said it planned to screen a banned documentary that examines Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role during 2002 anti-Muslim riots, prompting dozens of police equipped with tear gas and riot gear to gather outside campus gates

TITLE: Opium is surging in Myanmar, a top heroin producer, since its military took over
SUMMARY: A member of Pat Jasan, a grassroots organization motivated by their faith to root out the destructive influence of drugs, holds poppies as his group slashes and uproots them from a hillside, in Lung Zar village, northern Kachin State, Myanmar on Feb. 3, 2016

TITLE: In India, couples begin their legal battle for same-sex marriage
SUMMARY: Indian couple Utkarsh Saxena, left, and Ananya Kotia, chat inside a public park in New Delhi, India, Jan. 18, 2023. The couple, now 15 years into their relationship, is joined by three other couples who have filed a petition to India's Supreme Court that seeks the legalization of same-sex marriage

TITLE: Chinese balloon punctures Blinken's plans, leaving U.S.-China ties adrift
SUMMARY: President Biden stands with Chinese President Xi Jinping before a meeting on the sidelines of the G-20 summit meeting, Nov. 14, 2022, in Bali, Indonesia

TITLE: Despite billions to get off coal, why is Indonesia still building new coal plants?
SUMMARY: World leaders recently announced a $20 billion climate deal to help get Indonesia off coal power. But there are doubts about the deal because — for one thing — the country is planning to build new coal plants, including here in Kalimantan. Adek Berry/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Ex-Pakistan leader Pervez Musharraf, who aided U.S. war in Afghanistan, has died
SUMMARY: FILE - Pervez Musharraf addresses the U.N. General Assembly on Nov. 10, 2001, at the United Nations headquarters in New York. An official said Sunday, Feb. 5, 2023, Gen. Pervez Musharraf, Pakistan military ruler who backed US war in Afghanistan after 9/11, has died

TITLE: More than 1,000 are reported dead from an earthquake that has struck Turkey and Syria
SUMMARY: People and emergency teams rescue a person on a stretcher from a collapsed building in Adana, Turkey, Monday, Feb. 6, 2023

TITLE: China accuses the U.S. of indiscriminate use of force in shooting down of balloon
SUMMARY: Business owner "Annie" weights down copies of the Chinese Daily News newspaper showcasing pictures of a suspected Chinese spy balloon, in the Chinatown district of Los Angeles Sunday, Feb. 5, 2023

TITLE: A landmark subversion trial opens against high-profile Hong Kong democracy activists
SUMMARY: Pro-democracy activist Emily Lau Wai-hing gestures as she arrives at the West Kowloon Magistrates' Courts in Hong Kong, Monday, Feb. 6, 2023

TITLE: This wasn't the first Chinese balloon over the U.S. Why were the others ignored?
SUMMARY: The suspected Chinese spy balloon drifts to the ocean after being shot down off the coast in Surfside Beach, S.C., on Saturday

TITLE: Here's what we know about what caused the Turkey earthquake
SUMMARY: A man searches for people in the rubble of a destroyed building in Gaziantep, Turkey, on Monday, Feb. 6, 2023

TITLE: How a Chinese 'spy balloon' prompted the U.S. to scour the skies
SUMMARY: A high altitude balloon floats over Billings, Mont., on Feb. 1. Larry Mayer/The Billings Gazette/via AP

TITLE: One of 12 boys rescued from the Thai cave dies at a British school
SUMMARY: Relatives of Duangphet "Dom" Phromthep, one of the boys rescued from the flooded cave in northern Thailand, greet him as he arrives home in the Mae Sai district, Chiang Rai province, northern Thailand, in 2018

TITLE: How do pandemics begin? There's a new theory — and a new strategy to thwart them
SUMMARY: Relatives of Duangphet "Dom" Phromthep, one of the boys rescued from the flooded cave in northern Thailand, greet him as he arrives home in the Mae Sai district, Chiang Rai province, northern Thailand, in 2018

TITLE: Retirees in China hold rare protests against health insurance reforms
SUMMARY: Demonstrators gather outside Zhongshan Park in Wuhan, China, to protest changes to medical benefits, on Wednesday, in this still image from social media video obtained by Reuters. Social media via Reuters

TITLE: Indian tax inspectors leave BBC offices after nearly 60 hours of questioning
SUMMARY: A Border Police officer stands guard outside the office building where Indian tax authorities raided BBC's office in New Delhi. Sajjad Hussain/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Japan recounted its islands. Now geographers say there may be 7,000 more of them
SUMMARY: Japan conducted a recount of its number of islands amid criticism that the figures weren't correct. Geographers are expected to add more than 7,000 islands to the count

TITLE: Retirees took the streets in 2 Chinese cities to protest health care changes
SUMMARY: Private security guards close the gate of a building housing BBC office in New Delhi, India

TITLE: A dance of hope by children who scavenge coal
SUMMARY: Radhika (15), Anjali (16), Suman (21), and Suhani (15) in July 2022 perform a dance routine near the village of Sahana Pahari, Jharia. Walaa Alshaer for NPR

TITLE: A newborn delivered in the rubble of Turkey's earthquake is adopted by her relatives
SUMMARY: Khalil al-Sawadi holds Afraa, a baby girl who was born under the rubble caused by an earthquake that hit Syria and Turkey, on Monday in the town of Jinderis, Aleppo province, Syria

TITLE: China calls for a cease-fire and peace talks between Russia and Ukraine
SUMMARY: Wang Yi, China's director of the Office of the Central Foreign Affairs Commission, speaks during the Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany, Feb. 18, 2023. One year into Russia's war against Ukraine, China is offering a 12-point proposal to end the fighting

TITLE: The ripple effects of Russia's war in Ukraine continue to change the world
SUMMARY: Wang Yi, China's director of the Office of the Central Foreign Affairs Commission, speaks during the Munich Security Conference in Munich, Germany, Feb. 18, 2023. One year into Russia's war against Ukraine, China is offering a 12-point proposal to end the fighting

TITLE: The Taliban ended college for women. Here's how Afghan women are defying the ban
SUMMARY: In December, the Taliban banned female students from attending university. Some of them are turning to online options. Above: Afghan female students attend Kabul University in 2010

TITLE: North Korea says it test-fired 4 missiles a day after the U.S. held defense drills
SUMMARY: This photo provided by the North Korean government shows what it says is a launching drill of a cruise missile at an undisclosed location in North Korea on early Thursday

TITLE: Ex-husband and relatives charged in killing of Hong Kong model after body parts found
SUMMARY: In this image taken from video footage run by TVB Hong Kong, journalists film a police van believed to be carrying relatives of murdered model Abby Choi on its arrival at the Kowloon City Law Courts Building in Hong Kong, Monday, Feb. 27, 2023

TITLE: One of the last places to have a COVID mask mandate says it will lift it Wednesday
SUMMARY: Commuters wearing face masks ride a train in Hong Kong earlier this month

TITLE: Japan ad giant and other firms indicted over alleged Olympic contract bid-rigging
SUMMARY: The Japanese flag and Olympic rings are seen at the Japan Olympic Museum near the National Stadium in Tokyo on Feb. 17. Yuichi Yamazaki/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Ahead of China hearing, lawmakers share 'next steps' the U.S. can take for Uyghurs
SUMMARY: Rep. Mike Gallagher, R-Wis., center, and Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, D-Ill., right, are leading the newly-formed House Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party

TITLE: China accuses U.S. of containment and warns of potential conflict
SUMMARY: Chinese Foreign Minister Qin Gang waves as he arrives for a press conference held on the sidelines of the annual meeting of China's National People's Congress (NPC) in Beijing, Tuesday, March 7, 2023

TITLE: An explosion in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka kills 17 and injures more than 100
SUMMARY: Fire officials rescue an injured person from the debris of a commercial building after an explosion, in Dhaka, Bangladesh, Tuesday

TITLE: Germany moves toward restrictions on Huawei, as Europe sours on China
SUMMARY: Signs promoting 5G wireless technology from Chinese technology firm Huawei are displayed at the PT Expo in Beijing in 2018. Germany is reviewing the presence of Huawei and ZTE components in its telecommunications

TITLE: South Korea says again that Kim Jong Un has 3 children, and the eldest is a son
SUMMARY: People watch a television screen showing a news broadcast with an image of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, left, and his daughter presumed to be named Ju Ae attending a military parade held in Pyongyang to mark the 75th founding anniversary of its armed forces, at a railway station in Seoul on Feb. 9, 2023. JUNG YEON-JE/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Police try to stop International Women's Day protests in Pakistan. Protesters persist
SUMMARY: Policemen try to stop activists during a rally to mark International Women's Day in Islamabad on March 8 — and demand equal rights for women in Pakistan. Thousands of women took part in rallies across the country despite efforts by authorities in several cities to block the marches. Aamir Qureshi/ AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: No survivors aboard a plane that's been missing for over a month in the Philippines
SUMMARY: The global flagship store for Kura Sushi, a Japanese conveyor-belt sushi restaurant chain, is pictured here in January 2020 in Tokyo. Conveyor-belt sushi restaurants have been the target of a spate of pranks. Kazuhiro Nogi/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: 'Sushi terrorist' and 2 accomplices arrested in Japan after viral prank
SUMMARY: The global flagship store for Kura Sushi, a Japanese conveyor-belt sushi restaurant chain, is pictured here in January 2020 in Tokyo. Conveyor-belt sushi restaurants have been the target of a spate of pranks. Kazuhiro Nogi/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: 2 Indonesian soccer officials found guilty in one of the deadliest stadium stampedes
SUMMARY: Arema FC Organizing Committee chair Abdul Haris, left, the club's security chief Suko Sutrisno, center, walk to the courtroom to attend their sentencing hearing at a district court in Surabaya, East Java, Indonesia, Thursday, March 9, 2023

TITLE: China's Xi Jinping, as expected, gets 5 more years as state president
SUMMARY: Chinese President Xi Jinping takes his oath after he is unanimously elected as President during a session of China's National People's Congress (NPC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, Friday, March 10, 2023
